questions.question: Which of the following is NOT considered a non-communicable disease (NCD)?
questions.answer: Malaria

questions.question: What is the term for an imbalance in the microbial community of the body?
questions.answer: Dysbiosis

questions.question: Which ratio is often found to be higher in obese individuals compared to lean individuals?
questions.answer: Firmicutes to Bacteroidetes

questions.question: What are short-chain fatty acids (SCFAs) produced by?
choices: Gut bacteria through fermentation of dietary fiber
questions.answer: Gut bacteria through fermentation of dietary fiber

questions.question: Which microbial metabolite is associated with increased risk of atherosclerosis?
questions.answer: TMAO (Trimethylamine N-oxide)

questions.question: What is the gut-brain axis?
choices: A nerve connecting the gut to the brain
A bidirectional communication system between the gastrointestinal tract and central nervous system
A region of the brain responsible for digestion
questions.answer: A bidirectional communication system between the gastrointestinal tract and central nervous system

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a neurotransmitter produced by gut bacteria?
questions.answer: Cortisol

questions.question: What is a potential mechanism by which the microbiome may contribute to obesity?
questions.answer: Enhanced energy harvest from diet

questions.question: Which of the following is a potential microbiome-based intervention for cardiovascular disease?
choices: Targeting the gut microbiome to reduce TMAO production
Promoting the growth of pro-inflammatory bacteria
questions.answer: Targeting the gut microbiome to reduce TMAO production

questions.question: What is the term for probiotics that may have mental health benefits?
questions.answer: Psychobiotics

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical characteristic of the microbiome in obesity?
choices: Increased production of short-chain fatty acids
questions.answer: Increased production of short-chain fatty acids

questions.question: What is metabolic endotoxemia?
choices: A condition caused by excessive antibiotic use
The presence of bacterial toxins in the bloodstream, leading to low-grade inflammation
A side effect of probiotic supplementation
The process of breaking down complex carbohydrates in the gut
questions.answer: The presence of bacterial toxins in the bloodstream, leading to low-grade inflammation

questions.question: Which of the following is a potential mechanism by which the gut microbiome influences blood pressure?
questions.answer: Regulation of the renin-angiotensin system

questions.question: What is the primary source of TMAO production in the body?
questions.answer: Liver metabolism of microbial-derived trimethylamine

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical effect of short-chain fatty acids on health?
questions.answer: Increased systemic inflammation

questions.question: What is the potential link between the microbiome and depression?
choices: Increased production of stress hormones by gut bacteria
Direct bacterial colonization of brain tissue
questions.answer: Microbial influence on systemic inflammation

questions.question: Which of the following is a potential microbiome-based intervention for obesity?
choices: Antibiotics to eliminate all gut bacteria
questions.answer: Fecal microbiota transplantation

questions.question: What role does the microbiome play in insulin sensitivity?
choices: It has no effect on insulin sensitivity
It only affects insulin production, not sensitivity
It can influence insulin sensitivity through production of metabolites and regulation of inflammation
questions.answer: It can influence insulin sensitivity through production of metabolites and regulation of inflammation

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the relationship between stress and the gut microbiome?
choices: Stress has no impact on the gut microbiome
Stress only affects the microbiome in individuals with pre-existing gut disorders
There is a unidirectional relationship where stress impacts the microbiome but not vice versa
There is a bidirectional relationship between stress and the gut microbiome
questions.answer: There is a bidirectional relationship between stress and the gut microbiome

questions.question: What is a potential mechanism by which the gut microbiome might influence appetite regulation?
choices: Production of hormones that affect satiety
Altering the absorption of all nutrients
questions.answer: Production of hormones that affect satiety

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical recommendation for maintaining a healthy gut microbiome?
choices: Consuming a diverse range of plant-based foods
Including fermented foods in the diet
questions.answer: Regular use of broad-spectrum antibiotics

questions.question: What is the primary challenge in implementing microbiome-based interventions in Timor-Leste?
choices: Lack of interest from the population
Absence of gut bacteria in the Timorese population
Limited resources and infrastructure for advanced microbiome research and treatments
questions.answer: Limited resources and infrastructure for advanced microbiome research and treatments

questions.question: How might urbanization in Timor-Leste affect the population's microbiome?
choices: It would have no effect on the microbiome
It could lead to reduced microbial diversity due to changes in diet and lifestyle
It would always increase microbial diversity
It would only affect the skin microbiome, not the gut
questions.answer: It could lead to reduced microbial diversity due to changes in diet and lifestyle

questions.question: Which of the following is a potential benefit of traditional Timorese fermented foods?
choices: They have no impact on gut health
questions.answer: They may provide beneficial probiotics

questions.question: What is a key consideration when developing microbiome-aware public health strategies in Timor-Leste?
choices: Focusing only on expensive, high-tech interventions
questions.answer: Considering cultural factors and accessibility

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical component of a community workshop on microbiome and NCD prevention?
choices: Information on the link between diet and gut health
Prescription of antibiotics to all participants
Culturally appropriate recommendations for maintaining a healthy microbiome
questions.answer: Prescription of antibiotics to all participants

questions.question: What is the potential role of improving sanitation and water quality in Timor-Leste in relation to the microbiome and NCD risk?
choices: It would have no effect on the microbiome or NCD risk
It could potentially reduce exposure to harmful pathogens and promote a healthier microbiome
It would definitely eliminate all NCDs
It would only affect waterborne diseases, not NCDs
questions.answer: It could potentially reduce exposure to harmful pathogens and promote a healthier microbiome

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the current understanding of the microbiome's role in mental health?
choices: The microbiome has no influence on mental health
The microbiome is the sole cause of all mental health disorders
The microbiome may play a role in mental health through various mechanisms, including neurotransmitter production and inflammation regulation
The microbiome only affects mental health in individuals with pre-existing gut disorders
questions.answer: The microbiome may play a role in mental health through various mechanisms, including neurotransmitter production and inflammation regulation

questions.question: What is a potential ethical consideration in using fecal microbiota transplantation (FMT) as a treatment in Timor-Leste?
choices: Ensuring informed consent and addressing cultural sensitivities
FMT is illegal in all countries
FMT can only be performed on animals, not humans
questions.answer: Ensuring informed consent and addressing cultural sensitivities

questions.question: Which of the following is a potential barrier to adopting a 'microbiome-friendly' lifestyle in Timor-Leste?
choices: Excessive availability of diverse, plant-based foods
Too much leisure time for physical activity
Limited access to information about gut health
questions.answer: Limited access to information about gut health
